item: At least One Primary Maintainer has taken TBD Training on Secure Software Design

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [know_secure_design]

item: At least One Primary Maintainer has taken TBD Training on OWASP Top 10 or Equivalent

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [know_common_errors]

item: Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) Enforced Across the Github Organization

sources.description: OpenSSF SCM Best PracticesOpenSSF Best Practices Badge Gold Level [require_2FA]

item: Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) Enforced Across the npm Organization
Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) Enforced in All Tools Wherever Techncially Feasible
Use Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) Methods that Defend Against Impersonation when Available

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Gold Level [secure_2FA]

item: No Secrets and Credentials in Source Code

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [no_leaked_credentials]

item: Secrets are injected at runtime, such as environment variables or as a file (eg: use Github Secrets)
All Commits are Scanned for Secrets and Credentials
New Commits Containing Secrets or Credentials are Blocked from Merging

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [no_leaked_credentials]

item: Use SSH keys for developer access to source code repositories and use a passphrase
Publish to npm using an MFA-enabled account rather than single factor legacy or granular access tokens
Github Webhooks Use Secrets
Default Github Org Member Permissions Should Be Restricted
Only Admins Should Be Able To Create Public Repositories
[For Projects with Two or more Admins] Do not allow Admins to Bypass Branch Protection Settings

sources.description: Github Supply Chain Security Best Practices

item: Define roles aligned to functional responsibilities
Define Individuals/Teams who Write Access to a Github Repo
[For Projects with Two or more Owners] Have at least Two Owners Configured for Access Continuity

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Silver Level [access_continuity]

item: Actively Exploited Critical Vulnerabilities Patched within 30 Days

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [vulnerabilities_critical_fixed]

item: Non-Critical Exploitable Vulnerabilities Patched within 90 Days

sources.description: Google Project Zero Vulnerability Disclosure Policy

item: An automated process to identify dependencies with publicly disclosed vulnerabilities
Use an Automated Static Code Analysis Tool (eg: ESLInt)
Compilers/Linter Warnings Addressed in order to Merge

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Silver Level [warnings_strict]

item: All Commits are Scanned by a Static Application Security Testing Tool
All Required Commit Status Checks must pass before Merging
Security.md Meets OpenJS CVD Guidelines
Project Leverages a CVD Tool to Privately Receive/Manage External Vulnerability Reports (eg: H1/GH PVR)

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [vulnerability_report_private]

item: All External Vulnerability Reports Responded to <14 Days

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [vulnerability_report_response]

item: Establish a Clear Communication and Incident Response Plan
All Known Security Vulnerabilities are Issued a CVE

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [release_notes_vulns]

item: Release Notes must Include the CVE ID of Patched Security Vulnerabilities

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [release_notes_vulns]

item: Regression Tests for => 50% of Bugs and 100% of Security Vulns

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Silver Level [regression_tests_added50]

item: Github Org Default Workflow Token Permissions are Set to Read Only
Workflows are not Allowed To Create or Approve Pull Requests
Prevent Force Push on Default Branch
Prevent Default Branch Deletion
Default Branch must be Up to Date before Merging
GitHub Organization Secrets are Restricted to Selected Repositories
GitHub Actions Should Be Limited To Verified or Explicitly Trusted Actions
Disable use of Self-Hosted Runners in Github Org
Build Pipeline Cannot Execute Arbitrary Code from Outside of a Build Script
Only Allow Workflows Write Permissions at the Job-Level
Avoid Script Injection from Untrusted Context Variables
Consistent and Automated Build Process is Documented and Used
Commonly Used Older Versions Supported or Upgrade Path Provided/Documented

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Silver Level [maintenance_or_update]

item: [For Projects with Two or more Maintainers] Document Software Architecture

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Silver Level [documentation_architecture]

item: CI/CD steps should all be automated through a pipeline defined as code
Pin Actions with Access to Secrets to a Full Length Commit SHA
Automated Process is Used to Monitor for and Maintain a List of Out of Date Dependencies
[Freestanding Applications Only] A Machine Readable List of all Direct and Transitive Dependencies is Available for the Software
Modified dependencies are uniquely identified and distinct from origin dependency
A new release to refresh dependencies occurs at least annually

sources.description: OpenSSF Best Practices Badge Passing Level [maintained]
OpenSSF Great MFA Project Security Rationale

item: Non-Interactive Github: Use a passkey (AAL2) or hardware key (AAL3) that activates using a password or biometrics

sources.description: OpenSSF Great MFA Project Security Rationale

item: All Other Contexts: Use a passkey (AAL2) or hardware key (AAL3) that activates using a password or biometrics

sources.description: OpenSSF Great MFA Project Security Rationale

item: Limit changes from forks to workflows by requiring approval for all outside collaborators
Use a Workflow Security Scanner
Use a Github Runner Security Scanner
Github Organization Admins Should Have Activity In The Last 6 Months
Github Organization Members with Write Permissions Should Have Activity In The Last 6 Months
Require Pull Requests before Merging
Github Org Requires Commit Signoff for Web-Based Commits
Require Signed Commits
[Freestanding Applications Only] Commit a package-lock.json file with each release
[For Projects with Two or more Maintainers] Require Two Party Review
[For Projects with Four or more Maintainers] Require Code Owners Review
[For Projects with Two or more Maintainers] Require Approved PRs for all commits to mainline branches
Limit Number of Github Org Owners (ideally Fewer Than Three)
Limit Number of Github Repository Admins (ideally Fewer Than Three)
